speaker: FIRE CHIEF
line: Hurry and get him out of there. I need two men on the left side, now. Wait a second. Where are you going with him?

speaker: E.M.T.
line: He's dead.

speaker: FIRE CHIEF
line: Well, there's a woman over there who isn't, and she needs some oxygen.

speaker: FIRE CHIEF
line: Get on the horn, let them know we can release the hook and ladder in five minutes.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I want you to rise. Rise up and heal!

speaker: FIRE CHIEF
line: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: The boy's laying on hands.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Rise up and accept the miracle He has given you.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Amen. Hallelujah.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I have the Holy Spirit of God within me tonight.

speaker: FIRE CHIEF
line: You don't understand. The man's dead.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Then the boy can't possibly do any harm, now can he?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: For this is the power of belief, the power to separate the light from the darkness. To create life from death.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Amen.

speaker: FIRE CHIEF
line: All right, everyone! Show's over! Let's clear the area! Go on home! Let's start getting that 1-inch back in the truck.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Hallelujah, Samuel. Hallelujah.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Yes, indeedy, oh hallelujah! Hallellujah, praise God! Yes, indeedy, praise God! Yes. I want everybody to say 'Hallelujah'!

speaker: CROWD
line: Hallelujah!

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Praise the Lord!

speaker: SCULLY
line: The woman on the table has a malignant tumor on her spine. This boy, here, is going to attempt to heal her by simply laying his hands on her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where'd you get this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It came in from the regional office in Tennessee. The preacher's name is...

speaker: MULDER
line: Reverend Calvin Hartley.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've heard of him?

speaker: MULDER
line: The boy's his adopted son, Samuel. He claims to have found him as an infant lying in the tall weeds on the banks of the muddy Mississippi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you know that he also claims the boy brought a man back from the dead?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's more than a claim. The man he saved appears as a regular attraction in the Reverend's tent ministry. The boy's been performing miracles every week for the past ten years. Twice on Sundays.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, not according to the Kenwood Country sheriff. Local authorities think that Reverend Hartley and his son are a scam. They've been trying to shut him down for some time now, but without any luck, so they've turned to the FBI to try and get a prosecution.

speaker: MULDER
line: For what? Fraud?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, murder. Watch the tape.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Lucy Kelly has the cancer. Her doctors say it is inoperable. They say it is incurable. But I say to you that what the doctors cannot cure, the Lord can. Yes, indeedy, praise God! Because God can work miracles. Today the clear light of God's healing love is flowing through Samuel's healing hands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Twenty minutes later Lucy Kelly was rushed to the hospital. She was pronounced dead on arrival.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was the cause of death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, but it wasn't cancer. They've requested someone with a medical background to assist local police in the investigation. I know this isn't an X-File...

speaker: MULDER
line: When do we leave for Tennessee?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I saw some of these same people at Woodstock.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you weren't at Woodstock.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw the movie.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: You all right by yourself?

speaker: LILLIAN DANIELS
line: I'll be fine.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Good. I won't be long.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Most of you here today I know as neighbors and as cherished members of our Miracle Ministry. But some of you have come from far away, as far away as Pensacola, Florida, and Uniondale, Long Island. Wayne Ashton and his family. And it is especially to those of you who come from so far that I must apologize from the bottom of my heart, because unfortunately Samuel cannot be here this afternoon. I know, I know how very deeply disappointed each and every one of you must be feeling right now, but I say unto you, do not be dismayed. Do not despair. Do not lose your hope... because in two short days, Samuel will be back here at our very special Miracle Mission. Yes, indeed, praise God, he will be back here...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe we should head backstage and see what the Reverend has to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, wait, wait, this is the part where they bring out Elvis.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: ... on the faithful. Because as these blessed people up here are about to testify, Samuel can heal you. Samuel will heal you, but... only if you believe.

speaker: MAN
line: Fine sermon, Reverend!

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: God bless you!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Reverend Hartley? We're with the FBI.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I see Sheriff Daniels has sent in the cavalry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We just want to talk to Samuel for a couple of minutes, that's all.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: He's not here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, where is he?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I don't know. I haven't seen him. The boy's been a bit troubled lately.

speaker: VANCE
line: We're running late, Reverend.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: If you'll excuse me...

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Sheriff Daniels. We spoke on the phone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, yeah. This is Special Agent Dana Scully.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Right. You requested a copy of the coroner's report.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. Thank you.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I see you folks got a chance to take in the Holy Rollers' Sideshow.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something tells me you're not a member of the Reverend Hartley's flock.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Well, I remember Hartley when he was a soapbox preacher collecting dollar bills in coffee cans. Since the boy joined the act, he's got himself a Cadillac for every day of the week... bought for with money that should be used to improve our roads and schools.

speaker: MULDER
line: People want to believe, you know.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Ninety-nine percent of the people in this world are fools... and the rest of us are in great danger of contagion.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, even if Hartley and Samuel are fakes, it's still a long way from accusing the boy of murder.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I got witnesses that say the boy was there laying hands on those people when they died.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think that's how he killed them? With a touch?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I don't claim to know how or why he did it. But we've been looking for the boy since Tuesday, and he does not want to be found.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's nothing out of the ordinary about these reports, except that there were no autopsies performed.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Hartley managed to block my autopsy requests on religious grounds. Also doesn't help that the country coroner is a dues-paying member of the Miracle Ministry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe we can arrange to have the bodies exhumed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sheriff.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: It's Reverend Hartley's group. Damn. I told my people to keep quiet so this wouldn't happen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like you may have a few believers on the payroll.

speaker: VANCE
line: On behalf of the Miracle Ministry, we demand that you stop this sacrilege.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: You're not just dealing with me any more, Vance. You're dealing with the FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We don't mean you any disrespect. We're investigating a possible homicide, and federal law requires that we do a post-mortem examination on these bodies.

speaker: VANCE
line: I'm afraid we answer to an even higher authority than the U.S. government - one that considers grave digging and defiling corpses mortal sins.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: We'll get that autopsy, Vance, sooner or later. You know we will.

speaker: VANCE
line: The deceased's family does not want her grave disturbed.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Carol Wallace had no family.

speaker: VANCE
line: We were her family. We were her family, and it was hard enough to bury her once. So if you insist on going through with this, we are prepared to maintain a vigil and do whatever it takes to stop you.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Mulder? Scully? One of my men just spotted the boy's car downtown.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We can't do much here, anyway.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Not a very likely place to be saving souls.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Where's the boy, Zook?

speaker: ZOOK
line: He's in the can.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: What happened here?

speaker: ZOOK
line: That damned fool started a fight. Figures them Bible-thumpers wouldn't know how to hold their liquor.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Where you been, Samuel? We've been looking for you.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Yeah. I've been thinking.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Well, you're gonna have plenty of time for that now, son. I'm putting you under arrest.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: For murder?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: For suspicion of murder.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Mind if I finish my beer first?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: No, you go right on ahead. I'm gonna have someone take a statement from you. I'll see what I can do about getting your Caddy towed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Sheriff? What evidence do you have to charge the boy with murder?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Well, what more do you want? The boy's practically giving himself up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at him, though. He's drunk.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Then I'll add 'drunk and disorderly.' Let's get this straight. It's not a question about the boy's guilt - just how he did it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me have a minute with him?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Suit yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Samuel, I'm Agent Mulder. This is Agent Scully - from the FBI. Looks like you took quite a beating there.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Penance, Mr. Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Some might call it a plain old bar brawl.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: You know what they say - he giveth then he taketh away. A man gets too proud - sometimes it does him good to get the crap kicked out him. Saves God the trouble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The trouble of what?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Humbling the guilty sinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Guilty of murder?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you do it, Samuel?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Apparently, my pride and weakness were an invitation to the Devil. I muddied the river of my own faith. Now my gift has been corrupted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're saying that you killed those people with a touch?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I've laid my hands on the ill. Given them health. I've healed the sick. I've even touched the dying and given them life. God has given me a special gift.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he buy you all that jewelry, too? I think there's something missing in your story, Samuel.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Do you doubt the power of God, ma'am?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. But I doubt the veracity of your claims.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I've looked on the infirm and seen their sickness... their cancer. Just as I can see the pain on this man right here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really? What pain is that?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: The pain you have regarding a brother or a sister. It's an old pain. It's never been healed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this some kind of a trick?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: No trick, ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think we should get the sheriff...

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to hear more about this pain. Tell me.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I can see it, plain as day. It was a sister. You lost her, a sister quite young. Someone took her away.

speaker: MULDER
line: What else do you see?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Strangers. A bright light.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: You should have come here earlier. Chance I could have healed your pain.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: All right, let's get this over with.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, I need another minute with him.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I can't help you. Not any more. My gift is gone.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Cuff him. All right, let's go. You have the right to remain silent...

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: You have the right to an attorney...

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I'll tell you, Mr. Mulder. God watches over his flock. He gives us signs every day. Open your heart. He might just open your eyes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you think he does it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
line: Given his exemplary record, and the highly circumstatial nature of this case, I ask that my client be released on his own recognizance, without bail...

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Judge! That is not a good idea.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Samuel!

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Let me go and it'll be on your head!

speaker: JUDGE
line: Enough! This is not a pulpit. This is a court of law. Is that understood?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
line: Sorry.

speaker: DISTRICT ATTORNEY
line: Your honor. Despite the defendant's avowed guilt, we see no reason to burden the county with his maintenance until trial. But we do request a minimum bail of $100,000.

speaker: JUDGE
line: All right. If there are no objections, bail is set at $100,000, to be deposited directly into the clerk's probation account.

speaker: JUDGE
line: My God! What the... Good God! What is this? What?

speaker: DEFENSE ATTORNEY
line: Oh God!

speaker: SAMUEL
line: How much more will it take for you to believe? The Lord has testified against me. Does the serpent have to bite you all on the ass 'til you understand?

speaker: BALIFF
line: Everybody, clear this courtroom!

speaker: MULDER
line: "And when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts. And the locusts covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened and they did eat every herb of the...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: ... land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left."

speaker: SCULLY
line: A few thousand grasshoppers does not constitute a plague. Besides which, we're in farm country. This area is an agricultural smorgasbord for this type of infestation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, maybe in a cornfield, but this happened in a courtroom.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what's next? The slaying of the firstborn? Mulder, does this have something to do with what Samuel said in the bar last night - about your sister?

speaker: MULDER
line: I had these patient cases sent over from Kenwood County Hospital. These are physician-documented cases of patients who went to Samuel after conventional treatments failed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Spontaneous remission of metastatic cancer... regenerated nerve growth after post-trauma paraplegia..."

speaker: MULDER
line: I've encountered dozens of psychic healers in the X-Files, but none like this. I think the kid's for real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I admit this is intriguing, but there's a whole library of medical literature dealing with unexplained spontaneous cures.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, western medicine treats the human body in biochemical terms, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um-hmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: But the body can also be treated as an electromagnetic system.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So your theory is that if Samuel can repair this energy field in order to heal, he can also destroy it in order to kill.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK, say that Samuel's touch can kill. Why would he want to?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you heard him, Scully. He muddied the river of his own faith. That means he's...

speaker: VANCE
line: If you're available, the Reverend would like to see you.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I've been under a great deal of stress lately... which I know doesn't excuse my rude behavior yesterday, but I hope, somehow, you found it in your hearts to forgive me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why did you want to speak with us?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I need your help.

speaker: MULDER
line: Samuel's being tried for murder. I think what you need is a good lawyer.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Samuel is innocent.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, how can you be sure of that?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Because he's my son.

speaker: MULDER
line: Somehow, I don't think that argument will work on a jury. And Samuel's confession won't help much, either.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: You have to understand. Samuel is a very complicated young man. He feels things like no one else. To him, a pinprick becomes a gaping wound. His power comes from this ability to feel. But you see, some people fear that power. And out of their weakness and their fear, they seek to destroy it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean Sheriff Daniels?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I mean, it's no secret Sheriff Daniels has been trying to shut me down since I first opened my tent ten years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he seems to think that your ministry is a fraud.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: He's a faithless man, Agent Scully. His wife - she suffers from a most painful arthritis, her fingers twisted like bitter roots. Yet he keeps Samuel from ministering to her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In light of recent events, you can't blame him.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I don't know how those poor people died. I can't explain that. Which is why I'm asking you to be there tonight so you could see for yourselves, Samuel doing God's work. Can I count on you both to be there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think so. Mulder, what do you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, where'd she go?

speaker: MAN
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: A little girl.

speaker: MAN
line: There's no little girl around here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who? Jessica Hahn?

speaker: MULDER
line: A little girl.

speaker: VANCE
line: Well, brothers and sisters, help yourselves. Now, let folks with the wheelchairs though, now, that's right, don't be shy.

speaker: VANCE
line: Hello there, welcome to the Miracle Ministry. Y'all come to see Samuel tonight?

speaker: MARGARET'S MOTHER
line: Yes. Is he going to be here? The papers said...

speaker: VANCE
line: Oh, and don't mind what you read in the papers. God's work will be done. Young Samuel's here to cast out the Devil and heal the sick.

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: Did you hear that, honey?

speaker: MARGARET HOHMAN
line: Will he be able to see me?

speaker: VANCE
line: Well, I'll tell you what. I'm gonna put in a special word, hmm. What's your name, darling?

speaker: MARGARET HOHMAN
line: Margaret Hohman.

speaker: VANCE
line: Margaret? Well, Margaret, you wait right here. I'm gonna see if I can't get somebody to put you in the front row. How'd that be, huh?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I can't go out there... not after what's happened.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: God tests the faith in us all, son. And because He's chosen you to act in His likeness, He's given you the toughest test of all. Do not forsake your gifts, Samuel.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Aw, man...

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I'm a preacher, son. That's my gift. But all the preaching in the world could not equal even a small miracle in consolidating the faith and hope of these people. Let this man - - whose life you saved, give witness tonight to the grace and goodness of your healing power.

speaker: VANCE
line: They're all waiting on you, Samuel.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: Reverend Calvin Hartley.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Yes, indeedy, praise God. Hallelujah!

speaker: ALL
line: Hallelujah!

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Praise the Lord!

speaker: ALL
line: Praise the Lord!

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: God is here tonight. Oh, yes!

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: Pass it down please.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: I feel his presence. Oh, amen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apparently miracles don't come cheap.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: God is here, and He is here to heal!

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Yes, heal. Hallelujah. There's a man I'd like to introduce to you - a man who has seen the face of God but who was not satisfied to go to that great place, oh no. No, God had work for him to do right here on earth... as it is in heaven, mm-hmm. I saw this man come back from beyond death's door. He stands here today as a living testament to the ability of God to work miracles. Ladies and gentlemen, brothers and sisters, our beloved friend, Leonard Vance.

speaker: VANCE
line: As it says in John, chapter 3, "no man can do these miracles unless God be with him." That man, to whom I owe my life, is Samuel Hartley, and he is here tonight to heal you.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Thank you, Leonard. Ladies and gentlemen, God's soldier... Samuel Hartley.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Receive God's love. You have the power of God.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Pray with me.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Close your eyes.

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: What have you done, boy?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: All right, everyone, remain calm. Let's give the young woman some room here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm a doctor.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Everybody, praise God. Say hallelujah!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Somebody get an ambulance!

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: All right now, don't panic. Just praise the Lord!

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's dead.

speaker: VANCE
line: ... a loving friend. Children of God. Brothers and sisters. If you desecrate the body, then you slay the soul. Let's keep this poor woman's body intact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We know the Reverend Hartley's been pressuring you, but this is the third death linked with the Miracle Ministry.

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: Reverend Hartley says an autopsy is against scripture.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What illness did your daughter suffer from, Mr. Hohman?

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: She had M.S.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And has she ever had a siezure before this?

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: Not to my knowledge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You see, I think that the siezure she had is indicative of some kind of embolism or aneurysm.

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: But the boy only touched her forehead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And are you going to be content to bury her without knowing the true cause of death? Without knowing if there was foul play involved?

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: Give me a moment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think the boy really did it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was raised a Catholic, and I have a certain familiarity with the scripture. And God never lets the Devil steal the show.

speaker: MULDER
line: You must have really liked 'The Exorcist'?

speaker: SCULLY
line: One of my favorite movies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So who were you pursuing in the crowd tonight?

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought I saw someone I knew.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That boy really has you going, doesn't he?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In the bar, Samuel mentioned your sister. Is it your sister you keep thinking you're seeing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've seen her twice now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you just want to see her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh... I'm not delusional, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, don't discount the power of suggestion. A healer's greatest magic lies in the patient's willingness to believe. Imagine a miracle and you're halfway there. We learned that in med school.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think this is what Margaret Hohman and her parents were imagining?

speaker: MARGARET'S FATHER
line: We're gonna go along with your investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 11:21 pm, March 7. Subject's name is Margaret Hohman, female, caucasian, 107 pounds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, take a look at this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do I have to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lesions on the lungs here. I'm finding them throughout the cardiovascular and pulmonary systems. There's also a lot of damage to the mucous membranes. I think that she must have died from cellular hypoxia - a lack of oxygen to the cells.

speaker: MULDER
line: What would cause that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My guess? Ingestion or injection of sodium or potassium cyanide, maybe arsenic. I won't know exactly until I run a toxicology screen on her.

speaker: MULDER
line: How soon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Labs won't be open 'til morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: See who you can push to have it done, as soon as possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Samuel? It's Agent Mulder.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Yeah. What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to talk with you. If you'd prefer your attorney were present...

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Whatever. No.

speaker: MULDER
line: I put a call in to Sheriff Daniels. He's on his way down here. I'm gonna ask him to release you.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Why are you doing this? You were there, man. You saw for yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you poison Margaret Hohman?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Did I poison her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you poison her using potassium or sodium cyanide, because that's what killed her.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: You're innocent, Samuel - unless you had a hand in administering it, and I don't think you did.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Whatever the cause, Mr. Mulder, I am responsible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, the evidence will be presented at your arraignment tomorrow. The habeas corpus law will force them to release you, so you might as well go home and get some rest anyway.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Just leave me alone, OK?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Samuel, if you think that the punishment for your sins is the deaths of those people...

speaker: SAMUEL
line: The Lord has testified against me, Mr. Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't stand here and argue with your Biblical rhetoric, but I do know that the law will find you innocent!

speaker: MULDER
line: You said you could see my pain. Look at me. What do you see now?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I see nothing. I am blind.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe you. I've seen her. It was her, wasn't it?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Your sister?

speaker: MULDER
line: You made her appear to me, didn't you? Look at me.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I am very tired, Mr. Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is she alive? Is that what I'm supposed to believe, or is this a trick?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: You mean... a trick of the Devil?

speaker: MULDER
line: Jailer!

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I see I'm a little late for this ball.

speaker: MULDER
line: I called you down here to ask you to release the boy.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: On what pretense?

speaker: MULDER
line: His innocence.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Aren't you a little out of your depth, Agent Mulder? This may be Hicksville to you, but we do try and hew to the legal system.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't want to pick a fight. He seems determined to stay here anyway.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: What does that tell you?

speaker: MULDER
line: It tells me that you're determined to have him charged, while your real homicide suspect is still at large.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: I got some company for you, Sam.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: What are you looking at?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I'll get it. I'll get it.

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: Ma'am. Sheriff.

speaker: LILLIAN DANIELS
line: Hey, Dennis. How are you?

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: Just fine, ma'am, just fine. Except we had an incident down at the jail.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: What incident would that be, Tyson?

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: The preacher boy - he's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was alone in his cell when Mulder left him this morning. How could this have happened?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: The boy started a fight with a couple of rowdies we picked up on a DUI. He took some pretty mean blows to the head. He died before the ambulance got here.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: His blood is spilled! And it's all over you!

speaker: VANCE
line: Reverend...

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: How much longer are you gonna hide behind that badge before the truth is revealed.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I have work to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Reverend Hartley. We're sorry for your loss.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: That boy... he was blessed. He never hurt a soul.

speaker: VANCE
line: Come on now, Reverend. Our friends will be finding out about Samuel sooner than later, and well, it's probably best if they hear it from you. Come on. Ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've got that look on your face, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What look is that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The kind when you've forgotten your keys and you're trying to figure out how to get back in the house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly are we trying to find?

speaker: MULDER
line: Clues.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What does it mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's find out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. It's potato. Someone left a trail of food in the ventilation system, leading to the courtroom. You dump your locusts in here... instant plague.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, where did they all come from?

speaker: MULDER
line: Biological supply houses usually hatch them on order to farms and universities. It shouldn't be too hard to find out who set this up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you think whoever did this is responsible for the murders.

speaker: VANCE
line: You're dead. They killed you.

speaker: SAMUEL
line: I was dead. But here I am.

speaker: VANCE
line: No!

speaker: SAMUEL
line: Why did you betray me?

speaker: SAMUEL
line: You murdered those people. They came to me to be healed, and you murdered them. Why? After I gave you back your life?

speaker: VANCE
line: You call this life?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: What in tarnation do you want?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: We have a warrant for the arrest of Leonard Vance. Where is he?

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: You must be mistaken.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid not, Reverend. We've traced a pesticide order to him from a chemical company in Knoxville. Cyanogen bromide - it's a cyanide derivative.

speaker: REVEREND HARTLEY
line: Leonard poisoned those people?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Get your clothes on, Vance. You're under arrest.

speaker: VANCE
line: I betrayed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cyanide - there's no way to tell how much he's ingested.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll call an ambulance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's too late, we have to get him to the hospital ourselves.

speaker: VANCE
line: I thought, "why didn't he let me die?" Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep's clothing but inwardly are ravening wolves. That's what I thought he was, because who else would bring me back... looking like this. He was here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: VANCE
line: Samuel.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: The man's delirious.

speaker: VANCE
line: He was here, Reverend. Right in this room. And he forgave me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rather than simply killing Samuel, Vance contrived to kill the ministry's faith in him. We have conclusive evidence connecting him both to the courtroom infestation and to the poisoning deaths of three members of the ministry. Vance's obsession outlived Samuel, however. His conscience haunted him until he became delusory and finally took his own life, effectively ending our investigation. In light of this information, it is highly doubtful that there have ever been any miracles in Kenwood, Tennessee.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. Sheriff Daniels just called. Samuel's body is missing from the morgue.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any witnesses?

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: One, so far. The night nurse who made the report - Beatrice Salinger.

speaker: MULDER
line: She saw somebody take the body?

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: Not actually.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean, not actually?

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Talk sense, deputy.

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: She didn't exactly see anyone taking the body.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: Well, what then?

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: She, uh, she claims she saw Samuel walking out by himself. Sounds crazy, I know, but that's what she told me.

speaker: MULDER
line: You coming, Sheriff?

speaker: BEATRICE SALINGER
line: I was drinking my coffee and going over the night orders for my ward, 7 South, when he walked right by me. His face was all black and blue.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're sure it was him?

speaker: BEATRICE SALINGER
line: Well, at first I thought my eyes were playing tricks, which happens a lot on graveyard. So I got up to look again, but I lost him around the corner. He just vanished. Then I went to check the morgue, and his body was gone.

speaker: SHERIFF DANIELS
line: I don't believe this. This is insane. I'm not gonna listen to any more of this woman's crazy talk.

speaker: BEATRICE SALINGER
line: I'm not the only one who saw him, Sheriff, so I know I'm not crazy. Other people saw him, too. I'm not crazy. It was Samuel.

speaker: LILLIAN DANIELS
line: This isn't true, Maurice? Is it? The boy was an awful fake, just like you said, wasn't he Maurice? Wasn't he, Maurice?

speaker: DEPUTY TYSON
line: Sir... gonna have to ask you to come with me. District Attorney wants to ask you some questions concerning the boy's death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sundays will probably never be the same again in these parts.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a strong sense the Reverend Hartley's not going to be able to give up the pulpit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even without his son?

speaker: MULDER
line: It might even strengthen his faith. Remember, the boy did rise from the dead. That kind of thing happens only once or twice every two thousand years or so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, and I have a story about a plague of locusts. I just hope Reverend Hartley didn't arrange this body snatching as his miracle of miracles.

speaker: MULDER
line: Somehow, I don't think so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly do you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think people are looking hard for miracles... so hard that maybe they make themselves see what they want to see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You coming, Mulder?
